meaningMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>past</kanji>, and this verb means <vocabulary>to leave</vocabulary>. It should be easy to remember because you know what people say — you leave past in the past.
readingMnemonic: You will want <vocabulary>to leave</vocabulary>, if you see a <reading>saw</reading> (さ) pointing at you. You know saws can be deadly weapons, you should immediately leave when someone is brandishing one at you!
